Package org.jtrim2.executor

Class ContextAwareWrapper

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.executor.ContextAwareWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Executor, ContextAwareTaskExecutor, TaskExecutor
public final class ContextAwareWrapper extends Object implements ContextAwareTaskExecutor
A TaskExecutor implementation forwarding tasks to another task executor an being able to determine if tasks submitted to the ContextAwareWrapper run in the the context of the same ContextAwareWrapper.

It is also possible to create a task executor which shares execution context with the ContextAwareWrapper via the sameContextExecutor method.

This class may only be instantiated by the static factory methods in TaskExecutors: TaskExecutors.contextAware and TaskExecutors.contextAwareIfNecessary.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safely accessible from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Method of this class are not synchronization transparent unless otherwise noted.
See Also:
  • TaskExecutors.contextAware(TaskExecutor)
  • TaskExecutors.contextAwareIfNecessary(TaskExecutor)

  • Method Details

    • sameContextExecutor

      public ContextAwareWrapper sameContextExecutor(TaskExecutor executor)
      Returns an executor which submits tasks to the given executor and executes tasks in the same context as this executor. That is, calling the isExecutingInThis method of the returned executor is equivalent to calling the isExecutingInThis of this executor.

      Note that this method may or may not return a new instance.

      Parameters:
      executor - the specified executor to which the returned executor will submit tasks to. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      an executor which submits tasks to the given executor and executes tasks in the same context as this executor. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified executor is null

    • isExecutingInThis

      public boolean isExecutingInThis()
      Returns true if the calling code is executing in the context of this executor. That is, it is executed by a task submitted to this executor.

      This method can be used to check that a method call is executing in the context it was designed for.

      This method is synchronization transparent.

      Specified by:
      isExecutingInThis in interface ContextAwareTaskExecutor
      Returns:
      true if the calling code is executing in the context of this executor, false otherwise

    • executeFunction

      public <V> CompletionStage<V> executeFunction(CancellationToken cancelToken, CancelableFunction<? extends V> function)
      Executes the function at some time in the future. When and on what thread, the function is to be executed is completely implementation dependent. Implementations may choose to execute tasks later on a separate thread or synchronously in the calling thread at the discretion of the implementation.
      Specified by:
      executeFunction in interface TaskExecutor
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of the result of the submitted function
      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken which is to be checked if the submitted task is to be canceled. If this CancellationToken signals a cancellation request, this TaskExecutor may choose to not even attempt to execute the submitted task. This argument may not be null. When the task cannot be canceled, use the static Cancellation.UNCANCELABLE_TOKEN for this argument (even in this case, the TaskExecutor may be able to cancel the task, if it was not submitted for execution).
      function - the function to be executed by this TaskExecutor. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the CompletionStage which can be used to execute tasks after the completion of the submitted function and process the result of the submitted function. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • Cancellation.createCancellationSource()
      • Cancellation.UNCANCELABLE_TOKEN
